DataElement.preferredName: Supplements Vitamin E Compound Daily Intake Use Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Products in capsule, tablet or liquid form that provide essential nutrients, such as a vitamin, an essential mineral, a protein, an herb, or similar nutritional substance. Nutritional supplements do not require FDA approval to be marketed. (NCI)_A fat-soluble vitamin which is primarily a chain-breaking antioxidant that prevents the propagation of lipid peroxidation._Occurring or done each day._The process of taking in a substance, especially by eating or drinking, or the quantities thereof; admittance of people to a place or organization at a particular time._A manner, or usual, or accepted practice of using something._the yes/no indicator related to a patient's/participant's therapy.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Products in capsule, tablet or liquid form that provide essential nutrients, such as a vitamin, an essential mineral, a protein, an herb, or similar nutritional substance. Nutritional supplements do not require FDA approval to be marketed. (NCI)

Concepts.definition: Oral preparations containing dietary ingredient(s) intended to supplement the diet.  Dietary ingredients include vitamins, minerals, herbs, amino acids, extracts and metabolites.

Property.preferredName: Vitamin E Compound Daily Intake Use
Property.preferredDefinition: A fat-soluble vitamin which is primarily a chain-breaking antioxidant that prevents the propagation of lipid peroxidation.:Occurring or done each day.:Intake; the substances, or the quantities thereof, taken in and utilized by the body.:A manner, or usual, or accepted practice of using something.

Concepts.definition: A natural fat-soluble antioxidant with potential chemopreventive activity. Also known as tocopherol, vitamin E ameliorates free-radical damage to biological membranes, protecting polyunsaturated fatty acids (PUFA) within membrane phospholipids and within circulating lipoproteins. Peroxyl radicals react 1000-fold faster with vitamin E than with PUFA.  In the case of oxygen free radical-mediated tumorigenesis, vitamin E may be chemopreventive. (NCI04)
The process of taking in a substance, especially by eating or drinking, or the quantities thereof; admittance of people to a place or organization at a particular time.
A manner, or usual, or accepted practice of using something.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ReferenceDocuments.name: Is the patient taking greater
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient taking greater than 100 units of racemic vitamin E (or more than 50 units of aaa-tocopherol) daily, regardless of the indication within 5 days of starting study treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 01
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient receiving vitamin E supplementation greater than 100% of the daily recommended dose?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 02
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient receiving vitamin E supplementation (greater than or less than 100% of the daily recommended dose)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 001
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient receiving any vitamin E supplementation?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF_Text_1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient supplementing with vitamin E greater than 100% of the daily recommended dose?
